Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Mark backup folders as private" (#9129) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: They are already set as private in Blob Storage. There is no known scenario that needs public (unauthenticated) access to these blobs.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug]: Unable to load the service index for source https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json" (#9116) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe, Visual Studio Package Management UI, Visual Studio Package Manager Console

### Product Version

Windows 7 (6.1.7601 Service Pack 1 Build 7601)/ dotnet.exe/ VS2019 (16.11.11)/ nuget package manager (5.11.0)

### Worked before?

Cannot determine last known working version

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

## Using Package Management UI on Visual Studio 2019:
Searching for a package on the browse UI section
Expected Result:
A list of packages or one package shows
Actual Result:
[Screenshots](https://imgur.com/a/NkYaDgz)

## Using Package Manager Console on Visual Studio 2019:
Adding "RestSharp" package
Expected Result:
package installs successfully
Actual Result:
[Screenshot](https://imgur.com/a/LKqBGdI)

## Using dotnet via cmd:
Adding "RestSharp" package
Expected Result:
package installs successfully
Actual Result:
[Screenshot](https://imgur.com/a/8pRd9zn)

## Additional Information:
* Browsing [index.json](https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json) on Google Chrome (Version 100.0.4896.75 (Official Build) (64-bit)) works!
* Browsing [index.json](https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json) on Internet Explorer 11 (11.0.9600.17843) doesn't work!
* Tried to apply some registry fixes following this blog [devblogs.microsoft](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/deprecating-tls-1-0-and-1-1-on-nuget-org/)  without success


### Verbose Logs

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug]: nuget.exe command line keeps prompting for username/password" (#11852) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

NuGet.exe

### Product Version

NuGet Version: 6.1.0.106

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

_No response_

### Repro Steps & Context

I am trying to use NuGet packages with a pre-existing nightly build system, so I need to automatically check for missing / out of date NuGet package and update them if needed.

So far I've created a Visual Studio 2019 project which has a dependency for a NuGet package that exists inside my JFrog Artifactory repo online.

If I run the command `nuget restore demopack3.sln` in command prompt on my VS2019 solution file (.sln) it prompts me for my artifactory userName / password.

After I input my info, it correctly downloads the NuGet package. And I can run the command / delete my nuget package multiple times without being prompted for my username/password again. But occasionally, seemingly at random, it prompts me for my username/password manual entry

this is a problem because I need my `nuget restore` and `msbuild` commands to be ran automatically and without user input.

is there any way I can set my Artifactory username/password inside Windows Credentials Manager or some other automated way to avoid needing to manually enter my username/password when downloading NuGet packages from an Artifactory repo?

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug]: NuGet 6.2 incompatible with lock file from NuGet 6.1 - NU1101: Unable to find package" (#11851) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

MSBuild.exe, NuGet.exe

### Product Version

NuGet 6.2

### Worked before?

NuGet 6.1

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

Consider this csproj:

``` xml
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">
	<PropertyGroup>
		<TargetFramework>net6.0</TargetFramework>
		<RestorePackagesWithLockFile>true</RestorePackagesWithLockFile>
	</PropertyGroup>
	<ItemGroup>
		<PackageReference Include="Microsoft.CrmSdk.Data" Version="9.0.2.33" />
	</ItemGroup>
</Project>
```

1. Restore project with NuGet 6.1 `nuget.exe restore repro.csproj`. The lock file is:
``` json
{
  "version": 1,
  "dependencies": {
    "net6.0": {
      "Microsoft.CrmSdk.Data": {
        "type": "Direct",
        "requested": "[9.0.2.33, )",
        "resolved": "9.0.2.33",
        "contentHash": "gREfQl0/mh22+eV9h8PhCnAwNY5SJswLnUPxvxJwF6L2mhj5pMFMUSvlVke3Gpk94XCrBEyIgHJzFKDiMtA1aw=="
      }
    }
  }
}
```

3. Delete the obj\ directory. Restore project with NuGet 6.2. Receive error:
> NU1101: Unable to find package Microsoft.CrmSdk.CoreAssemblies. No packages exist with this id in source(s): Microsoft Visual Studio Offline Packages, nuget.org

Workaround - delete the lock file. The new lock file is:

``` json
{
  "version": 1,
  "dependencies": {
    "net6.0": {
      "Microsoft.CrmSdk.Data": {
        "type": "Direct",
        "requested": "[9.0.2.33, )",
        "resolved": "9.0.2.33",
        "contentHash": "gREfQl0/mh22+eV9h8PhCnAwNY5SJswLnUPxvxJwF6L2mhj5pMFMUSvlVke3Gpk94XCrBEyIgHJzFKDiMtA1aw==",
        "dependencies": {
          "Microsoft.CrmSdk.CoreAssemblies": "9.0.2"
        }
      },
      "Microsoft.CrmSdk.CoreAssemblies": {
        "type": "Transitive",
        "resolved": "9.0.2.1",
        "contentHash": "68WUDm0RFg9RjrkxU8cTqc+bRsKa55YkG2SM81rNVMFUtNL56FlGW5gifoaABbR7KU15+myXTA/a+Vqbqc6vQQ=="
      }
    }
  }
}
```

Note the additional dependency on `Microsoft.CrmSdk.CoreAssemblies`.

The lock file generated by 6.2 is compatible with 6.1.



### Verbose Logs

```shell
C:\Users\user\Downloads\test3>..\nuget-6.2.exe restore repro.csproj
MSBuild auto-detection: using msbuild version '17.2.1.25201' from 'C:\Program Files\Microsoft Visual Studio\2022\Enterprise\MSBuild\Current\bin'.
Restoring packages for C:\Users\user\Downloads\test3\repro.csproj...
NU1101: Unable to find package Microsoft.CrmSdk.CoreAssemblies. No packages exist with this id in source(s): Microsoft Visual Studio Offline Packages, nuget.org
WARNING: NU1701: Package 'Microsoft.CrmSdk.Data 9.0.2.33' was restored using '.NETFramework,Version=v4.6.1, .NETFramework,Version=v4.6.2, .NETFramework,Version=v4.7, .NETFramework,Version=v4.7.1, .NETFramework,Version=v4.7.2, .NETFramework,Version=v4.8' instead of the project target framework 'net6.0'. This package may not be fully compatible with your project.
Generating MSBuild file C:\Users\user\Downloads\test3\obj\repro.csproj.nuget.g.props.
Generating MSBuild file C:\Users\user\Downloads\test3\obj\repro.csproj.nuget.g.targets.
Writing assets file to disk. Path: C:\Users\user\Downloads\test3\obj\project.assets.json
Failed to restore C:\Users\user\Downloads\test3\repro.csproj (in 583 ms).

Errors in C:\Users\user\Downloads\test3\repro.csproj
    NU1101: Unable to find package Microsoft.CrmSdk.CoreAssemblies. No packages exist with this id in source(s): Microsoft Visual Studio Offline Packages, nuget.org

NuGet Config files used:
    C:\Users\user\AppData\Roaming\NuGet\NuGet.Config
    C:\Program Files (x86)\NuGet\Config\Microsoft.VisualStudio.Offline.config

Feeds used:
    C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft SDKs\NuGetPackages\
    https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json


C:\Users\user\AppData\Roaming\NuGet\NuGet.Config:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<configuration>
  <packageSources>
    <add key="nuget.org" value="https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json" protocolVersion="3" />
  </packageSources>
</configuration>

C:\Program Files (x86)\NuGet\Config\Microsoft.VisualStudio.Offline.config:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<configuration>
  <packageSources>
    <add key="Microsoft Visual Studio Offline Packages" value="C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft SDKs\NuGetPackages\"/>
  </packageSources>
</configuration>
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug]: Visual Studio 2019 can't find private Artifactory NuGet package" (#11796) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

MSBuild.exe, NuGet.exe, Visual Studio Package Management UI, Visual Studio Package Manager Console

### Product Version

visual studio 2019

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

I'm unable to use this version

### Repro Steps & Context

Download nuget for the Win10 command line. 
Download Visual Studio 2019.
Setup a JFrog Artifactory repo online.


Recently I used Visual Studio to package a NuGet `.nupkg` file, and then used the following commands to push my .nupkg file to a private artifactory repo:
```
$ nuget sources Add -Name Artifactory -Source https://myurl/artifactory/api/nuget/ult-testware-nuget -username aaaaaa -password bbbbbb
$ nuget setapikey aaaaaa:bbbbbb -Source Artifactory
$ nuget push ClassLibrary2.1.0.0.nupkg -Source Artifactory
```
I can verify that it was uploaded and is visible online:
[![enter image description here][1]][1]

My private artifactory url is added to vscode as a NuGet source:
[![enter image description here][2]][2]

But when I try to browse for NuGet packages using that source, I get no results. Even with prerelease checked, and after refreshing/restarting VS, [![enter image description here][3]][3]


Do I need to re-authenticate Visual Studio with my private JFrog Artifactory repo somehow? I'm hoping to see and download the NuGet package I just pushed up.

I also tried adding to my NuGet.Config file another NuGet source:
```
    <add key="ArtifactoryNuGetV3" value="https://myurl/artifactory/api/nuget/v3/ult-testware-nuget" protocolVersion="3" />
  </packageSources>
```
But that does not work.

One of the artifactory source urls I added links to my repo, and when I selected it to browse, I get a popup asking for username/password. After entering I get an error saying 404 (so I think the auth was a success, but its searching for my package in the wrong place)
```
[artifcator2] The V2 feed at 'https://myurl/artifactory/ult-testware-nuget/ClassLibrary2.1.0.0.nupkg/Search()?$filter=IsLatestVersion&searchTerm=''&targetFramework='netcoreapp3.1'&includePrerelease=false&$skip=0&$top=26&semVerLevel=2.0.0' returned an unexpected status code '404 '.
```
If I remove everything from the url so it is just ```https://myurl/artifactory/ult-testware-nuget/ClassLibrary2.1.0.0.nupkg/``` and look it up in my browser, it either shows 
``` 404: "{\"error\":\"Expected a folder but found a file, at: ult-testware-nuget:ClassLibrary2.1.0.0.nupkg\"}" ``` or If I remove the last slash it begins to download

Thanks

  [1]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/AA7m3.png
  [2]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/kg7nq.png
  [3]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/cJyjw.png

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Feature]: nuget.exe uninstall command" (#11850) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Involved

NuGet.exe

### The Elevator Pitch

nuget.exe has an install command but no uninstall command.  This is an obvious oversight and quite annoying when needed.
This is especially important when nuget.exe has been run outside any project, thus making the installed packages unavailable to commands that can only be run in a project context.

### Additional Context and Details

Running "nuget.exe install packagename" outside any project installs the package under the current directory where the user happens to run the command.  Such packages don't appear in the output of PowerShell Get-Package, and there is no easily found information on how to list or remove packages installed that way.

If this installation method is unintended and removed in a future nuget.exe version, users will still need a tool to uninstall those things.

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "[Bug]: [Bug Bash] The “Version” dropdown box is blank in “Consolidate” tab of solution-level PM UI" (#11806) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

Dev\6.3.0.51

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

### Details about Problem
VS Version: Main\32509.107
NuGet Version: Dev\6.3.0.51
OS Version: Windows-11-Enterprise-21H2

### Repro steps:
1.Create a solution with two C# Console App (.NET Framework 4.8) projects in VS.
2.Right-Click the solution in the Solution Explorer and select the “Mange NuGet Packages for Solution”.
3.Go to “Browse” tab, select a package (e.g. Newtonsoft.Json) and install different versions (with PackageReference format) into the different projects. (e.g. install 12.0.1 into the first project, install 12.0.2 into the second project)
4.Click the “Consolidate” tab, click the package “Newtonsoft.Json” in the list and observe the “Version” dropdown box.

### Expected:
The “Version” dropdown box is showing the latest installed version (12.0.2 in this instance), the version in the drowdown list can be reselected and the "Install" button is available.

### Actual:
The “Version” dropdown box is blank, the version in the drowdown list cannot be reselected and the "Install" button is not available as below.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632625/167605435-14c7b265-c080-4976-bea9-a5117312a08a.png)

### Notes:
1. This issue starts to repro on Dev\6.3.0.10, does not repro on Dev\6.3.0.9.
2. It does not repro on .NET SDK style solution.
3. It does not repro when the package is installed with “packages.config” format in step3.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_
